sect1.title: Backward incompatible changes
sect1.simpara: Although most existing PHP 5 code should work without changes, please take note of some backward incompatible changes:

sect2.title: Array keys won't be overwritten when defining an array as a property of a class via an array literal
sect2.para: Previously, arrays declared as class properties which mixed explicit and implicit keys could have array elements silently overwritten if an explicit key was the same as a sequential implicit key. For example:
sect2.informalexample:
<?php
class C {
    const ONE = 1;
    public $array = [
        self::ONE => 'foo',
        'bar',
        'quux',
    ];
}

var_dump((new C)->array);
?>

   
   &example.outputs.55;
   

array(2) {
  [0]=>
  string(3) "bar"
  [1]=>
  string(4) "quux"
}


   
   &example.outputs.56;
   

array(3) {
  [1]=>
  string(3) "foo"
  [2]=>
  string(3) "bar"
  [3]=>
  string(4) "quux"
}

sect2.title: json_decode strictness
sect2.para: json_decode now rejects non-lowercase variants of the JSON literals &true;, &false; and null at all times, as per the JSON specification, and sets json_last_error accordingly. Previously, inputs to json_decode that consisted solely of one of these values in upper or mixed case were accepted.
This change will only affect cases where invalid JSON was being passed to json_decode: valid JSON input is unaffected and will continue to be parsed normally.

sect1.sect2:
Stream wrappers now verify peer certificates and host names by default when using SSL/TLS
&migration56.openssl.peer-verification;

sect2.title: GMP resources are now objects
sect2.para: GMP resources are now objects. The functional API implemented in the GMP extension has not changed, and code should run unmodified unless it checks explicitly for a resource using is_resource or similar.

sect2.title: Mcrypt functions now require valid keys and IVs
sect2.para: mcrypt_encrypt, mcrypt_decrypt, mcrypt_cbc, mcrypt_cfb, mcrypt_ecb, mcrypt_generic and mcrypt_ofb will no longer accept keys or IVs with incorrect sizes, and block cipher modes that require IVs will now fail if an IV isn't provided.

sect2.title: cURL file uploads
sect2.para: Uploads using the @file syntax now require CURLOPT_SAFE_UPLOAD to be set to &false;. CURLFile should be used instead.
